title: Heating moratorium ends Sunday; officials say don't get cut off
title_page: Heating moratorium ends Sunday; officials say don't get cut off
maintext:
The heating moratorium in Wisconsin ends Sunday, so residents who were able to keep warm all winter under state law but have problems paying utility bills should make arrangements as soon as possible with their utility companies.
Otherwise, non-payers who haven’t arranged to a payment plan could be kept in the dark, legally.
“Utility service may be disconnected on or after April 16, if energy bills have not been paid or a payment plan has not been arranged with the utility,” the Public Service Commission of Wisconsin said.
Utilities are prohibited from disconnecting customers between Nov. 1 and April 15 for non-payment of utility bills, for the health and safety of residents.
Financial help for heating bills is available through the Wisconsin Home Energy Assistance Program, and utilities also try to work with customers so service is not disconnected.
In the Madison area, the two major power providers are Madison Gas & Electric, 252-7144, and Alliant Energy, 800-255-4268.
“Customers who have contacted their utility but cannot reach a payment agreement should contact PSC Consumer Affairs,” the PSC said.
The toll-free PSC number is 800-225-7729 and in the Madison area, 608-266-2001.
